alert.note: Alert for Bath; Menifee; Morgan; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 5:24PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Morgan, southeastern Bath, northeastern Menifee and southwestern Rowan Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 524 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Young Springs, or 8 miles southeast of Owingsville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Midland around 535 PM EDT. Farmers and Ramey around 540 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Yale, Cogswell, Freestone, Bluestone, Zilpo, Bangor, Morehead, Brandy, Clearfield, Lick Fork, Pelfrey, Crix, Rodburn, Craney, Paragon and Munson. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 121 and 144. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
